Eager to discover new insights by synthesizing technology, business, and art. Named as a Meinig Scholar, awarded to 1.3% of Cornell undergrads for leadership and academic excellence.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Automated DNS reroutes in AWS, Route 53 for thousands of video calls, cutting time to resolution by 80% and minimizing self-induced outages, incorporated data validation, using JavaScript and Node.js. Streamlined server deployment: automated IPMI configurations, DHCP reservations, and machine inventory; saving 96 man-hours annually and eliminating human error, using Python, Bash, and Device42 API. Implemented a scalable SSD health-monitoring feature for 3000+ servers to eliminate storage-induced outages, predict time to failure by analyzing usage trends, using Intel MAS.

work.title: Data Structures + OO Programming Teaching Assistant
work.description: Course staff for a record class of 670+ students; developing tools to optimize grading workflow. Facilitating discussion sections of 48 students, holding weekly office hours, and moderating discussion boards.

work.title: Software Developer
work.description: Working on Zing, an app to optimize student grouping with nearly 1000 users from 300+ courses. Built search bar + loading screen for Zing using TypeScript, React, and MUI, enabled cross-listed classes in Firebase, used React hooks to standardize URLs, and redesigning emailing feature with Azure.

work.title: Program Management Intern
work.description: Co-founded the Monthly App Challenge program, led weekly web dev workshops for 20-50 students worldwide to solve real-world problems with tech, bolstered attendance by 700% in half year. Revamped website UI/UX and surged page traffic by 4x, used HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Devised 1 year curriculum for 30+ student startups, supporting innovation, rapid development, and efficient market entry. Coaching a student tech startup to solve mental health for space industries, using React and Machine Learning.

work.title: Bioinformatics Research Assistant
work.description: Normalized, visualized, and performed differential analysis on human and equine genes using R, DESeq2, and EdgeR. Presented research on how gene expression can influence the risk of knee osteoarthritis.

projects.title: Circus: Connecting Freelancing Services
projects.description: Built a scalable iOS app to connect Cornell students with the freelancing community, using Python and Swift. Wrote 15+ REST API endpoints using Flask, implemented session-based authentication, architected database in SQLite and SQLAlchemy, and containerized/deployed using Docker and GCP. Awarded Best Frontend/UI by Cornell App Development out of 150+ students.

projects.title: Cars 4: Not a Pixar Movie
projects.description: Predicted car manufacturer and price from 427,000 instances and 20+ features. Trained linear regression, KNN classification, and decision tree classifier models in Python. Performed extensive data analysis and visualization using Jupyter and Matplotlib.

projects.title: Vobyus: AI Car Dashboard
projects.description: Co-founded student entrepreneurship team, won 1st place at the 2021 Model Entrepreneur Competition by Columbia Business School and recognized as a Conrad Innovator. Led development of smart car dashboard, detecting drowsiness with 85% accurcy to prevent vehicle accidents, used JavaScript, Python, TensorFlow.

projects.title: AI Art Critic
projects.description: Trained classification models with 25,000 images to critique art, designed algorithms to analyze pixels in Python. Developed a website using Django and hosted on Google Cloud.
